lines.text:
[to Tilford as he enters bus station on stormy night]
Hot stove make all akin on night like this.
Did you find out anything, Pop?
Not enough to fill up ear of gnat.
Believe if you will consent to bait trap, we may catch same.
I'll be very glad to do anything I can to help.
Thank you. My first thought, of course, was police, but ancient proverb say, "Never bait trap with wolf to catch wolf."

[Referring to Charlie]
Hey, Jimmy, what does he mean about Bureau of Missing Persons?
Well, that's where you find things that are missing.
I'm missing my breakfast. Let's find that.
Number Two Son like flea on dog - always must have fine tooth comb to find same.
Who do you think I am? Man O' War? I ain't run this fast since I ran into a hornet's nest!

[Watching a frightened Birmingham repeatedly crash into the wall on the stair landing of the morgue]
Where are you going, Birmingham? That's not a door up there!
It will be in a minute.

[to Birmingham and Jimmy in the curio shop]
Are you gentlemen interested in buying any curios?
Well, I'm curious enough to make my departure. Would you kindly tell me where the door is please?
Confucius say sleep only an escape from yesterday.
